body.p: Disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC) is a result of __________.

input.choice: an imbalance in the coagulation and fibrinolysis

feedback.p: Incorrect. Tissue factor induces the extrinsic pathway.
Correct. DIC is due to a homeostatic imbalance between the rate of coagulation and the rate of fibrionolysis.

body.p: People can acutely die of a heart attack because __________.

input.choice: the lungs can no longer exchange gasses
the cells of the body die from lack of blood flow
the autonomic nervous system responds so strongly that it causes a stroke

feedback.p: Incorrect. The lungs can continue to exchange gasses as long as flow is sent to them.
Correct. If someone has a severe heart attack their cardiac output will fall enough that the needs of the body won’t be met, and the cells (such as those in the brain), will die.
Incorrect. Although the heart may beat irregularly, this, by itself, will not lead to death.
Incorrect. Although the autonomic nervous system will respond to try to maintain cardiac output, it won’t cause a stroke.

body.p: Tissues can regulate blood flow to themselves by __________.

input.choice: sending signals to the autonomic nervous system
releasing chemicals that will either constrict or dilate local blood vessels.
sending signals to the heart to increase or decrease cardiac output.
sending signals to the brain to signal it to increase or decrease heart rate

feedback.p: Incorrect. Tissues locally control their blood flow without the need for nervous system involvement.
Correct. Local signaling molecules might include K+, ADP, H+, endothelin, etc., which have their effects on local blood vessels.
Incorrect. Tissues locally control blood flow without the need for signals to the heart.
Incorrect. Tissues locally control blood flow without the need for nervous system involvement.
